taskbody.context: Using the pgAdmin 4 query tool, you can run a query with EXPLAIN to view the details of the query plan. The output includes details about operations unique to Greenplum distributed query processing such as plan slices and motions between segments. You can view a graphical depiction of the plan as well as the text-based data output.

step.cmd: With the correct database schema highlighted in the object browser in the left pane, select Tools > Query Tool from the top menu bar. You can open multiple query tabs by selecting the option multiple times.

Enter the query by typing in the SQL Editor, dragging objects into the Graphical Query Builder, or opening a file. Click on the lightning bolt and go to the Explain Options in the dropdown to make sure the Verbose option is not selected. (Verbose must be deselected to view a graphical depiction of the query plan.)
Click on Explain in the the dropdown menu to trigger the operation. Note: The Explain Analyze function is not currently available with Greenplum Database.
step.stepresult:
The query plan displays in the Output pane at the bottom of the screen. Select the Explain tab to view the graphical output. For example: Graphical Query Plan in pgAdmin 4
You can also view the history of the queries you have run by simply clicking on the Query History tab to view the result. Viewing Query History
